info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 8:33PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Swain and northeastern Graham Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 833 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Robbinsville, or near Fontana Lake, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fontana Lake, Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Fontana Village, Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek, Smoky Mountains-Clingmans Dome, Smoky Mountains-Deep Creek, Smoky Mountains-Oconaluftee and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
